<JD_START>
Job Title: Business Development Analyst

Location: United States

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Business Development, Marketing, Sales

Description:
The Business Development Analyst actively works to identify and nurture strategic relationships with partners and/ or potential customers. They will assist in the development of a strong sales pipeline of new business opportunities through direct or indirect customer contact and prospecting. Works closely with marketing, sales, and product development teams to implement business development initiatives. Conduct market research, help implement new business strategies, and help solidify existing client relationships. Strive to attract new clients while maintaining existing relationships. Become experts in company’s vision and mission, seek to accomplish set goals and objectives.These Goals and objectives are not to be construed as a complete statement of all duties performed; employees will be required to perform other job-related duties as required. Goals and objectives are subject to change.All activities must be in compliance with Equal Employment Opportunity laws, HIPAA, ERISA and other regulations, as appropriate. Essential Functions: Execute sales plans and strategic prospecting campaigns.Assist in supporting and growing existing accounts.Conduct market research and identify new business opportunity.Work closely with sales management to ensure all stakeholders are informed of progress.Document all activity and sales process in CRM.Assist in creating sales material and presentations as required.Provide support to the sales and marketing teams on all aspects of the sales process.Maintain a positive, customer-focused attitude in a highly intense environment.Interact with all employees and customers in a professional and courteous manner.Work in a team setting to accomplish goals.Other work duties, as assigned.Travel 25%Minimum Requirements:Bachelor’s Degree in Business, Finance, Marketing, or Equivalent Work Experience2-4 years related experience.Excellent communication (written and oral) and interpersonal skills.Strong organizational, multi-tasking, and time-management skills.Must be detail oriented and able to follow through on issues to resolution.Why join our team?If you join us, you will receive:Work remotely with a work/life balance approachRobust benefits offering, including 401(k)Generous time off allotments10 paid holidays annuallyEmployer-paid short term disability and life insurancePaid Parental Leave

Experience Level (if available): Associate
<JD_END>
